36 static inline void sirius_exit(int error_code__, std::string msg__ = "")
37 {
38  switch (error_code__) {
39  case SIRIUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN: {
40  printf("SIRIUS: unknown error\n");
41  break;
42  }
43  case SIRIUS_ERROR_RUNTIME: {
44  printf("SIRIUS: run-time error\n");
45  break;
46  }
47  case SIRIUS_ERROR_EXCEPTION: {
48  printf("SIRIUS: exception\n");
49  break;
50  }
51  default: {
52  printf("SIRIUS: unknown error code: %i\n", error_code__);
53  break;
54  }
55  }
56 
57  if (msg__.size()) {
58  printf("%s\n", msg__.c_str());
59  }
60  if (!Communicator::is_finalized()) {
61  Communicator::world().abort(error_code__);
62  }
63  fflush(stdout);
64  std::cout << std::flush;
65  std::exit(error_code__);
66 }
67 
68 template <typename F>
69 static void call_sirius(F&& f__, int* error_code__)
70 {
71  try {
72  f__();
73  if (error_code__) {
74  *error_code__ = SIRIUS_SUCCESS;
75  return;
76  }
77  }
78  catch (std::runtime_error const& e) {
79  if (error_code__) {
80  *error_code__ = SIRIUS_ERROR_RUNTIME;
81  return;
82  } else {
83  sirius_exit(SIRIUS_ERROR_RUNTIME, e.what());
84  }
85  }
86  catch (std::exception const& e) {
87  if (error_code__) {
88  *error_code__ = SIRIUS_ERROR_EXCEPTION;
89  return;
90  } else {
91  sirius_exit(SIRIUS_ERROR_EXCEPTION, e.what());
92  }
93  }
94  catch (...) {
95  if (error_code__) {
96  *error_code__ = SIRIUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN;
97  return;
98  } else {
99  sirius_exit(SIRIUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN);
100  }
101  }
102 }

104 sirius::Simulation_context& get_sim_ctx(void* const* h)
105 {
106  if (h == nullptr || *h == nullptr) {
107  throw std::runtime_error("Non-existing simulation context handler");
108  }
109  return static_cast<utils::any_ptr*>(*h)->get<sirius::Simulation_context>();
110 }

115  throw std::runtime_error("Non-existing DFT ground state handler");
116  }
117  return static_cast<utils::any_ptr*>(*h)->get<sirius::DFT_ground_state>();

128 /// Index of Rlm in QE in the block of lm coefficients for a given l.
129 static inline int idx_m_qe(int m__)
130 {
131  return (m__ > 0) ? 2 * m__ - 1 : -2 * m__;
132 }
133 
134 /// Mapping of atomic indices from SIRIUS to QE order.
135 static inline std::vector<int> atomic_orbital_index_map_QE(sirius::Atom_type const& type__)
136 {
137  int nbf = type__.mt_basis_size();
138 
139  std::vector<int> idx_map(nbf);
140  for (int xi = 0; xi < nbf; xi++) {
141  int m = type__.indexb(xi).m;
142  int idxrf = type__.indexb(xi).idxrf;
143  idx_map[xi] = type__.indexb().index_by_idxrf(idxrf) + idx_m_qe(m); /* beginning of lm-block + new offset in lm block */
144  }
145  return idx_map;
146 }
147 
148 static inline int phase_Rlm_QE(::sirius::Atom_type const& type__, int xi__)
149 {
150  return (type__.indexb(xi__).m < 0 && (-type__.indexb(xi__).m) % 2 == 0) ? -1 : 1;
151 }

155 /*
156 @api begin
157 sirius_initialize:
158  doc: Initialize the SIRIUS library.
159  arguments:
160  call_mpi_init:
161  type: bool
162  attr: in, required
163  doc: If .true. then MPI_Init must be called prior to initialization.
164 @api end
165 */
166 void sirius_initialize(bool const* call_mpi_init__)
167 {
168  sirius::initialize(*call_mpi_init__);
169 }
170 
171 /*
172 @api begin
173 sirius_finalize:
174  doc: Shut down the SIRIUS library
175  arguments:
176  call_mpi_fin:
177  type: bool
178  attr: in, optional
179  doc: If .true. then MPI_Finalize must be called after the shutdown.
180  call_device_reset:
181  type: bool
182  attr: in, optional
183  doc: If .true. then cuda device is reset after shutdown.
184  call_fftw_fin:
185  type: bool
186  attr: in, optional
187  doc: If .true. then fft_cleanup must be called after the shutdown.
188 @api end
189 */
190 void sirius_finalize(bool const* call_mpi_fin__, bool const *call_device_reset__, bool const* call_fftw_fin__)
191 {
192  bool mpi_fin{true};
193  bool device_reset{true};
194  bool fftw_fin{true};
195 
196  if (call_mpi_fin__!= nullptr) {
197  mpi_fin = *call_mpi_fin__;
198  }
199 
200  if (call_device_reset__ != nullptr) {
201  device_reset = *call_device_reset__;
202  }
203 
204  if (call_fftw_fin__ != nullptr) {
205  fftw_fin = *call_fftw_fin__;
206  }
207 
208  sirius::finalize(mpi_fin, device_reset, fftw_fin);
209 }

243 /*
244 @api begin
245 sirius_print_timers:
246  doc: Print all timers.
247  arguments:
248  flatten:
249  type: bool
250  attr: in, required
251  doc: If true, flat list of timers is printed.
252 @api end
253 */
254 void sirius_print_timers(bool* flatten__)
255 {
256  auto timing_result = ::utils::global_rtgraph_timer.process();
257  if (*flatten__) {
258  timing_result = timing_result.flatten(1).sort_nodes();
259  }
260  std::cout << timing_result.print({rt_graph::Stat::Count, rt_graph::Stat::Total, rt_graph::Stat::Percentage,
261  rt_graph::Stat::SelfPercentage, rt_graph::Stat::Median, rt_graph::Stat::Min,
262  rt_graph::Stat::Max});
263 }
264 
265 /*
266 @api begin
267 sirius_serialize_timers:
268  doc: Save all timers to JSON file.
269  arguments:
270  fname:
271  type: string
272  attr: in, required
273  doc: Name of the output JSON file.
274 @api end
275 */
276 void sirius_serialize_timers(char const* fname__)
277 {
278  auto timing_result = ::utils::global_rtgraph_timer.process();
279  std::ofstream ofs(fname__, std::ofstream::out | std::ofstream::trunc);
280  ofs << timing_result.json();
281 }

283 /*
284 @api begin
285 sirius_integrate:
286  doc: Spline integration of f(x)*x^m.
287  arguments:
288  m:
289  type: int
290  attr: in, required
291  doc: Defines the x^{m} factor.
292  np:
293  type: int
294  attr: in, required
295  doc: Number of x-points.
296  x:
297  type: double
298  attr: in, required
299  doc: List of x-points.
300  f:
301  type: double
302  attr: in, required
303  doc: List of function values.
304  result:
305  type: double
306  attr: out, required
307  doc: Resulting value.
308 @api end
309 */
310 void sirius_integrate(int const* m__, int const* np__, double const* x__, double const* f__, double* result__)
311 {
312  sirius::Radial_grid_ext<double> rgrid(*np__, x__);
313  sirius::Spline<double> s(rgrid, std::vector<double>(f__, f__ + *np__));
314  *result__ = s.integrate(*m__);
315 }

317 /*
318 @api begin
319 sirius_context_initialized:
320  doc: Check if the simulation context is initialized.
321  arguments:
322  handler:
323  type: void*
324  attr: in, required
325  doc: Simulation context handler.
326  status:
327  type: bool
328  attr: out, required
329  doc: Status of the library (true if initialized)
330  error_code:
331  type: int
332  attr: out, optional
333  doc: Error code.
334 @api end
335 */
336 void sirius_context_initialized(void* const* handler__, bool* status__, int* error_code__)
337 {
338  call_sirius([&]()
339  {
340  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
341  *status__ = sim_ctx.initialized();
342  }, error_code__);
343 }
344 
345 /*
346 @api begin
347 sirius_create_context:
348  doc: Create context of the simulation.
349  full_doc: Simulation context is the complex data structure that holds all the parameters of the
350  individual simulation.
351 
352  The context must be created, populated with the correct parameters and
353  initialized before using all subsequent SIRIUS functions.
354  arguments:
355  fcomm:
356  type: int
357  attr: in, required
358  doc: Entire communicator of the simulation.
359  handler:
360  type: void*
361  attr: out, required
362  doc: New empty simulation context.
363  error_code:
364  type: int
365  attr: out, optional
366  doc: Error code.
367 @api end
368 */
369 void sirius_create_context(int const* fcomm__, void** handler__, int* error_code__)
370 {
371  call_sirius([&]()
372  {
373  auto& comm = Communicator::map_fcomm(*fcomm__);
374  *handler__ = new utils::any_ptr(new sirius::Simulation_context(comm));
375  }, error_code__);
376 }
377 
378 /*
379 @api begin
380 sirius_import_parameters:
381  doc: Import parameters of simulation from a JSON string
382  arguments:
383  handler:
384  type: void*
385  attr: in, required
386  doc: Simulation context handler.
387  str:
388  type: string
389  attr: in, optional
390  doc: JSON string with parameters or a JSON file.
391  error_code:
392  type: int
393  attr: out, optional
394  doc: Error code
395 @api end
396 */
397 void sirius_import_parameters(void* const* handler__, char const* str__, int* error_code__)
398 {
399  call_sirius([&]()
400  {
401  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
402  if (str__) {
403  sim_ctx.import(std::string(str__));
404  } else {
405  sim_ctx.import(sim_ctx.get_runtime_options_dictionary());
406  }
407  }, error_code__);
408 }

410 /*
411 @api begin
412 sirius_set_parameters:
413  doc: Set parameters of the simulation.
414  arguments:
415  handler:
416  type: void*
417  attr: in, required
418  doc: Simulation context handler
419  lmax_apw:
420  type: int
421  attr: in, optional
422  doc: Maximum orbital quantum number for APW functions.
423  lmax_rho:
424  type: int
425  attr: in, optional
426  doc: Maximum orbital quantum number for density.
427  lmax_pot:
428  type: int
429  attr: in, optional
430  doc: Maximum orbital quantum number for potential.
431  num_fv_states:
432  type: int
433  attr: in, optional
434  doc: Number of first-variational states.
435  num_bands:
436  type: int
437  attr: in, optional
438  doc: Number of bands.
439  num_mag_dims:
440  type: int
441  attr: in, optional
442  doc: Number of magnetic dimensions.
443  pw_cutoff:
444  type: double
445  attr: in, optional
446  doc: Cutoff for G-vectors.
447  gk_cutoff:
448  type: double
449  attr: in, optional
450  doc: Cutoff for G+k-vectors.
451  fft_grid_size:
452  type: int
453  attr: in, optional, dimension(3)
454  doc: Size of the fine-grain FFT grid.
455  auto_rmt:
456  type: int
457  attr: in, optional
458  doc: Set the automatic search of muffin-tin radii.
459  gamma_point:
460  type: bool
461  attr: in, optional
462  doc: True if this is a Gamma-point calculation.
463  use_symmetry:
464  type: bool
465  attr: in, optional
466  doc: True if crystal symmetry is taken into account.
467  so_correction:
468  type: bool
469  attr: in, optional
470  doc: True if spin-orbit correnctio is enabled.
471  valence_rel:
472  type: string
473  attr: in, optional
474  doc: Valence relativity treatment.
475  core_rel:
476  type: string
477  attr: in, optional
478  doc: Core relativity treatment.
479  iter_solver_tol:
480  type: double
481  attr: in, optional
482  doc: Tolerance of the iterative solver.
483  iter_solver_tol_empty:
484  type: double
485  attr: in, optional
486  doc: Tolerance for the empty states.
487  iter_solver_type:
488  type: string
489  attr: in, optional
490  doc: Type of iterative solver.
491  verbosity:
492  type: int
493  attr: in, optional
494  doc: Verbosity level.
495  hubbard_correction:
496  type: bool
497  attr: in, optional
498  doc: True if LDA+U correction is enabled.
499  hubbard_correction_kind:
500  type: int
501  attr: in, optional
502  doc: Type of LDA+U implementation (simplified or full).
503  hubbard_orbitals:
504  type: string
505  attr: in, optional
506  doc: Type of localized orbitals.
507  sht_coverage:
508  type: int
509  attr: in, optional
510  doc: Type of spherical coverage (0 for Lebedev-Laikov, 1 for uniform).
511  min_occupancy:
512  type: double
513  attr: in, optional
514  doc: Minimum band occupancy to trat is as "occupied".
515  smearing:
516  type: string
517  attr: in, optional
518  doc: Type of occupancy smearing.
519  smearing_width:
520  type: double
521  attr: in, optional
522  doc: Smearing width
523  spglib_tol:
524  type: double
525  attr: in, optional
526  doc: Tolerance for the spglib symmetry search.
527  error_code:
528  type: int
529  attr: out, optional
530  doc: Error code.
531 @api end
532 */
533 void sirius_set_parameters(void* const* handler__,
534  int const* lmax_apw__,
535  int const* lmax_rho__,
536  int const* lmax_pot__,
537  int const* num_fv_states__,
538  int const* num_bands__,
539  int const* num_mag_dims__,
540  double const* pw_cutoff__,
541  double const* gk_cutoff__,
542  int const* fft_grid_size__,
543  int const* auto_rmt__,
544  bool const* gamma_point__,
545  bool const* use_symmetry__,
546  bool const* so_correction__,
547  char const* valence_rel__,
548  char const* core_rel__,
549  double const* iter_solver_tol__,
550  double const* iter_solver_tol_empty__,
551  char const* iter_solver_type__,
552  int const* verbosity__,
553  bool const* hubbard_correction__,
554  int const* hubbard_correction_kind__,
555  char const* hubbard_orbitals__,
556  int const* sht_coverage__,
557  double const* min_occupancy__,
558  char const* smearing__,
559  double const* smearing_width__,
560  double const* spglib_tol__,
561  int* error_code__)
562 {
563  call_sirius([&]()
564  {
565  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
566  if (lmax_apw__ != nullptr) {
567  sim_ctx.set_lmax_apw(*lmax_apw__);
568  }
569  if (lmax_rho__ != nullptr) {
570  sim_ctx.set_lmax_rho(*lmax_rho__);
571  }
572  if (lmax_pot__ != nullptr) {
573  sim_ctx.set_lmax_pot(*lmax_pot__);
574  }
575  if (num_fv_states__ != nullptr) {
576  sim_ctx.num_fv_states(*num_fv_states__);
577  }
578  if (num_bands__ != nullptr) {
579  sim_ctx.num_bands(*num_bands__);
580  }
581  if (num_mag_dims__ != nullptr) {
582  sim_ctx.set_num_mag_dims(*num_mag_dims__);
583  }
584  if (pw_cutoff__ != nullptr) {
585  sim_ctx.pw_cutoff(*pw_cutoff__);
586  }
587  if (gk_cutoff__ != nullptr) {
588  sim_ctx.gk_cutoff(*gk_cutoff__);
589  }
590  if (auto_rmt__ != nullptr) {
591  sim_ctx.set_auto_rmt(*auto_rmt__);
592  }
593  if (gamma_point__ != nullptr) {
594  sim_ctx.gamma_point(*gamma_point__);
595  }
596  if (use_symmetry__ != nullptr) {
597  sim_ctx.use_symmetry(*use_symmetry__);
598  }
599  if (so_correction__ != nullptr) {
600  sim_ctx.so_correction(*so_correction__);
601  }
602  if (valence_rel__ != nullptr) {
603  sim_ctx.valence_relativity(valence_rel__);
604  }
605  if (core_rel__ != nullptr) {
606  sim_ctx.core_relativity(core_rel__);
607  }
608  if (iter_solver_tol__ != nullptr) {
609  sim_ctx.iterative_solver_tolerance(*iter_solver_tol__);
610  }
611  if (iter_solver_tol_empty__ != nullptr) {
612  sim_ctx.empty_states_tolerance(*iter_solver_tol_empty__);
613  }
614  if (iter_solver_type__ != nullptr) {
615  sim_ctx.iterative_solver_type(std::string(iter_solver_type__));
616  }
617  if (verbosity__ != nullptr) {
618  sim_ctx.verbosity(*verbosity__);
619  }
620  if (hubbard_correction__ != nullptr) {
621  sim_ctx.set_hubbard_correction(*hubbard_correction__);
622  }
623  if (hubbard_correction_kind__ != nullptr) {
624  if (*hubbard_correction_kind__ == 0) {
625  sim_ctx.set_hubbard_simplified_version();
626  }
627  }
628  if (hubbard_orbitals__ != nullptr) {
629  std::string s(hubbard_orbitals__);
630  if (s == "ortho-atomic") {
631  sim_ctx.set_orthogonalize_hubbard_orbitals(true);
632  }
633  if (s == "norm-atomic") {
634  sim_ctx.set_normalize_hubbard_orbitals(true);
635  }
636  }
637  if (fft_grid_size__ != nullptr) {
638  sim_ctx.fft_grid_size({fft_grid_size__[0], fft_grid_size__[1], fft_grid_size__[2]});
639  }
640  if (sht_coverage__ != nullptr) {
641  sim_ctx.sht_coverage(*sht_coverage__);
642  }
643  if (min_occupancy__ != nullptr) {
644  sim_ctx.min_occupancy(*min_occupancy__);
645  }
646  if (smearing__ != nullptr) {
647  sim_ctx.smearing(smearing__);
648  }
649  if (smearing_width__ != nullptr) {
650  sim_ctx.smearing_width(*smearing_width__);
651  }
652  if (spglib_tol__ != nullptr) {
653  sim_ctx.cfg().control().spglib_tolerance(*spglib_tol__);
654  }
655  }, error_code__);
656 }

733  attr: out, optional
734  doc: Verbosity level.
735  hubbard_correction:
736  type: bool
737  attr: out, optional
738  doc: True if LDA+U correction is enabled.
739  evp_work_count:
740  type: double
741  attr: out, optional
742  doc: Internal counter of total eigen-value problem work.
743  num_loc_op_applied:
744  type: int
745  attr: out, optional
746  doc: Internal counter of the number of wave-functions to which Hamiltonian was applied.
747  num_sym_op:
748  type: int
749  attr: out, optional
750  doc: Number of symmetry operations discovered by spglib
751  electronic_structure_method:
752  type: string
753  attr: out, optional
754  doc: Type of electronic structure method.
755  error_code:
756  type: int
757  attr: out, optional
758  doc: Error code.
759 @api end
760 */
761 void sirius_get_parameters(void* const* handler__,
762  int* lmax_apw__,
763  int* lmax_rho__,
764  int* lmax_pot__,
765  int* num_fv_states__,
766  int* num_bands__,
767  int* num_spins__,
768  int* num_mag_dims__,
769  double* pw_cutoff__,
770  double* gk_cutoff__,
771  int* fft_grid_size__,
772  int* auto_rmt__,
773  bool* gamma_point__,
774  bool* use_symmetry__,
775  bool* so_correction__,
776  double* iter_solver_tol__,
777  double* iter_solver_tol_empty__,
778  int* verbosity__,
779  bool* hubbard_correction__,
780  double* evp_work_count__,
781  int* num_loc_op_applied__,
782  int* num_sym_op__,
783  char* electronic_structure_method__,
784  int* error_code__)
785 {
786  call_sirius([&]()
787  {
788  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
789  if (lmax_apw__) {
790  *lmax_apw__ = sim_ctx.lmax_apw();
791  }
792  if (lmax_rho__) {
793  *lmax_rho__ = sim_ctx.lmax_rho();
794  }
795  if (lmax_pot__) {
796  *lmax_pot__ = sim_ctx.lmax_pot();
797  }
798  if (num_fv_states__) {
799  *num_fv_states__ = sim_ctx.num_fv_states();
800  }
801  if (num_bands__) {
802  *num_bands__ = sim_ctx.num_bands();
803  }
804  if (num_spins__) {
805  *num_spins__ = sim_ctx.num_spins();
806  }
807  if (num_mag_dims__) {
808  *num_mag_dims__ = sim_ctx.num_mag_dims();
809  }
810  if (pw_cutoff__) {
811  *pw_cutoff__ = sim_ctx.pw_cutoff();
812  }
813  if (gk_cutoff__) {
814  *gk_cutoff__ = sim_ctx.gk_cutoff();
815  }
816  if (auto_rmt__) {
817  *auto_rmt__ = sim_ctx.auto_rmt();
818  }
819  if (gamma_point__) {
820  *gamma_point__ = sim_ctx.gamma_point();
821  }
822  if (use_symmetry__) {
823  *use_symmetry__ = sim_ctx.use_symmetry();
824  }
825  if (so_correction__) {
826  *so_correction__ = sim_ctx.so_correction();
827  }
828  if (iter_solver_tol__) {
829  *iter_solver_tol__ = sim_ctx.iterative_solver_tolerance();
830  }
831  if (iter_solver_tol_empty__) {
832  *iter_solver_tol_empty__ = sim_ctx.cfg().iterative_solver().empty_states_tolerance();
833  }
834  if (verbosity__) {
835  *verbosity__ = sim_ctx.verbosity();
836  }
837  if (hubbard_correction__) {
838  *hubbard_correction__ = sim_ctx.hubbard_correction();
839  }
840  if (fft_grid_size__) {
841  for (int x: {0, 1, 2}) {
842  fft_grid_size__[x] = sim_ctx.fft_grid()[x];
843  }
844  }
845  if (evp_work_count__) {
846  *evp_work_count__ = sim_ctx.evp_work_count();
847  }
848  if (num_loc_op_applied__) {
849  *num_loc_op_applied__ = sim_ctx.num_loc_op_applied();
850  }
851  if (num_sym_op__) {
852  if (sim_ctx.use_symmetry()) {
853  *num_sym_op__ = sim_ctx.unit_cell().symmetry().num_mag_sym();
854  } else {
855  *num_sym_op__ = 0;
856  }
857  }
858  if (electronic_structure_method__) {
859  auto str = sim_ctx.cfg().parameters().electronic_structure_method();
860  std::copy(str.c_str(), str.c_str() + str.length() + 1, electronic_structure_method__);
861  }
862  }, error_code__);
863 }

1073 /*
1074 @api begin
1075 sirius_set_periodic_function_ptr:
1076  doc: Set pointer to density or megnetization.
1077  arguments:
1078  handler:
1079  type: void*
1080  attr: in, required
1081  doc: Handler of the DFT ground state object.
1082  label:
1083  type: string
1084  attr: in, required
1085  doc: Label of the function.
1086  f_mt:
1087  type: double
1088  attr: in, optional
1089  doc: Pointer to the muffin-tin part of the function.
1090  f_rg:
1091  type: double
1092  attr: in, optional
1093  doc: Pointer to the regualr-grid part of the function.
1094 @api end
1095 */
1096 void sirius_set_periodic_function_ptr(void* const* handler__,
1097  char const* label__,
1098  double* f_mt__,
1099  double* f_rg__)
1100 {
1101  auto& gs = get_gs(handler__);
1102  std::string label(label__);
1103 
1104  std::map<std::string, sirius::Periodic_function<double>*> func_map = {
1105  {"rho", &gs.density().component(0)},
1106  {"magz", &gs.density().component(1)},
1107  {"magx", &gs.density().component(2)},
1108  {"magy", &gs.density().component(3)},
1109  {"veff", &gs.potential().component(0)},
1110  {"bz", &gs.potential().component(1)},
1111  {"bx", &gs.potential().component(2)},
1112  {"by", &gs.potential().component(3)},
1113  {"vha", &gs.potential().hartree_potential()}
1114  };
1115 
1116  sirius::Periodic_function<double>* f;
1117  try {
1118  f = func_map.at(label);
1119  } catch(...) {
1120  std::stringstream s;
1121  s << "wrong label: " << label;
1122  TERMINATE(s);
1123  }
1124 
1125  if (f_mt__) {
1126  f->set_mt_ptr(f_mt__);
1127  }
1128  if (f_rg__) {
1129  f->set_rg_ptr(f_rg__);
1130  }
1131 }
1132 
1133 /*
1134 @api begin
1135 sirius_set_periodic_function:
1136  doc: Get values of the periodic function.
1137  arguments:
1138  handler:
1139  type: void*
1140  attr: in, required
1141  doc: Handler of the DFT ground state object.
1142  label:
1143  type: string
1144  attr: in, required
1145  doc: Label of the function.
1146  f_rg:
1147  type: double
1148  attr: in, optional, dimension(*)
1149  doc: Real space values on the regular grid.
1150  f_rg_global:
1151  type: bool
1152  attr: in, optional
1153  doc: If true, real-space array is global.
1154  error_code:
1155  type: int
1156  attr: out, optional
1157  doc: Error code.
1158 
1159 @api end
1160 */
1161 void sirius_set_periodic_function(void* const* handler__, char const* label__, double const* f_rg__,
1162  bool const* f_rg_global__, int* error_code__)
1163 {
1164  call_sirius([&]()
1165  {
1166  auto& gs = get_gs(handler__);
1167  std::string label(label__);
1168  std::map<std::string, sirius::Periodic_function<double>*> func_map = {
1169  {"rho", &gs.density().component(0)},
1170  {"magz", &gs.density().component(1)},
1171  {"magx", &gs.density().component(2)},
1172  {"magy", &gs.density().component(3)},
1173  {"veff", &gs.potential().component(0)},
1174  {"bz", &gs.potential().component(1)},
1175  {"bx", &gs.potential().component(2)},
1176  {"by", &gs.potential().component(3)},
1177  {"vha", &gs.potential().hartree_potential()}
1178  };
1179  if (func_map.count(label) == 0) {
1180  throw std::runtime_error("wrong label (" + label + ") for the periodic function");
1181  }
1182  if (f_rg__) {
1183  if (f_rg_global__ == nullptr) {
1184  throw std::runtime_error("missing bool argument `f_rg_global`");
1185  }
1186  bool is_local = !(*f_rg_global__);
1187  func_map[label]->copy_from(nullptr, f_rg__, is_local);
1188  }
1189  }, error_code__);
1190 }

1193 @api begin
1194 sirius_get_periodic_function:

1196  arguments:
1197  handler:
1198  type: void*
1199  attr: in, required
1200  doc: Handler of the DFT ground state object.
1201  label:
1202  type: string
1203  attr: in, required

1208  doc: Real space values on the regular grid.

1210  type: bool
1211  attr: in, optional

1213  error_code:
1214  type: int
1215  attr: out, optional
1216  doc: Error code.
1217 
1218 @api end

1220 void sirius_get_periodic_function(void* const* handler__, char const* label__, double* f_rg__,
1221  bool const* f_rg_global__, int* error_code__)
1222 {
1223  call_sirius([&]()
1224  {
1225  auto& gs = get_gs(handler__);
1226  std::string label(label__);
1227  std::map<std::string, sirius::Periodic_function<double>*> func_map = {
1228  {"rho", &gs.density().component(0)},
1229  {"magz", &gs.density().component(1)},
1230  {"magx", &gs.density().component(2)},
1231  {"magy", &gs.density().component(3)},
1232  {"veff", &gs.potential().component(0)},
1233  {"bz", &gs.potential().component(1)},
1234  {"bx", &gs.potential().component(2)},
1235  {"by", &gs.potential().component(3)},
1236  {"vha", &gs.potential().hartree_potential()}

1239  throw std::runtime_error("wrong label (" + label + ") for the periodic function");
1240  }

1251 /*
1252 @api begin
1253 sirius_create_kset:
1254  doc: Create k-point set from the list of k-points.
1255  arguments:
1256  handler:
1257  type: void*
1258  attr: in, required
1259  doc: Simulation context handler.
1260  num_kpoints:
1261  type: int
1262  attr: in, required
1263  doc: Total number of k-points in the set.
1264  kpoints:
1265  type: double
1266  attr: in, required, dimension(3,num_kpoints)
1267  doc: List of k-points in lattice coordinates.
1268  kpoint_weights:
1269  type: double
1270  attr: in, required, dimension(num_kpoints)
1271  doc: Weights of k-points.
1272  init_kset:
1273  type: bool
1274  attr: in, required
1275  doc: If .true. k-set will be initialized.
1276  kset_handler:
1277  type: void*
1278  attr: out, required
1279  doc: Handler of the newly created k-point set.
1280  error_code:
1281  type: int
1282  attr: out, optional
1283  doc: Error code.
1284 @api end
1285 */
1286 void sirius_create_kset(void* const* handler__, int const* num_kpoints__, double* kpoints__,
1287  double const* kpoint_weights__, bool const* init_kset__, void** kset_handler__,
1288  int* error_code__)
1289 {
1290  call_sirius([&]()
1291  {
1292  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
1293 
1294  mdarray<double, 2> kpoints(kpoints__, 3, *num_kpoints__);
1295 
1296  sirius::K_point_set* new_kset = new sirius::K_point_set(sim_ctx);
1297  new_kset->add_kpoints(kpoints, kpoint_weights__);
1298  if (*init_kset__) {
1299  new_kset->initialize();
1300  }
1301  *kset_handler__ = new utils::any_ptr(new_kset);
1302  }, error_code__);
1303 }

1306 @api begin

1311  type: void*
1312  attr: in, required
1313  doc: Simulation context handler.

1317  doc: dimensions of the k points grid.
1318  k_shift:
1319  type: int
1320  attr: in, required, dimension(3)
1321  doc: k point shifts.
1322  use_symmetry:
1323  type: bool
1324  attr: in, required
1325  doc: If .true. k-set will be generated using symmetries.
1326  kset_handler:
1327  type: void*
1328  attr: out, required
1329  doc: Handler of the newly created k-point set.
1330  error_code:
1331  type: int
1332  attr: out, optional
1333  doc: Error code.
1334 @api end
1335 */
1336 void sirius_create_kset_from_grid(void* const* handler__, int const* k_grid__, int const* k_shift__,
1337  bool const* use_symmetry, void** kset_handler__, int* error_code__)
1338 {

1340  {
1341  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);

1343  std::vector<int> k_shift(3);
1344 
1345  k_grid[0] = k_grid__[0];
1346  k_grid[1] = k_grid__[1];
1347  k_grid[2] = k_grid__[2];
1348 
1349  k_shift[0] = k_shift__[0];
1350  k_shift[1] = k_shift__[1];
1351  k_shift[2] = k_shift__[2];
1352 
1353  sirius::K_point_set* new_kset = new sirius::K_point_set(sim_ctx, k_grid, k_shift, *use_symmetry);
1354 
1355  *kset_handler__ = new utils::any_ptr(new_kset);
1356  }, error_code__);
1357 }

1412 /*
1413 @api begin
1414 sirius_find_ground_state:
1415  doc: Find the ground state.
1416  arguments:
1417  gs_handler:
1418  type: void*
1419  attr: in, required
1420  doc: Handler of the ground state.
1421  density_tol:
1422  type: double
1423  attr: in, optional
1424  doc: Tolerance on RMS in density.

1434  type: bool
1435  attr: in, optional
1436  doc: boolean variable indicating if we want to save the ground state.
1437 @api end
1438 */
1439 void sirius_find_ground_state(void* const* gs_handler__,
1440  double const* density_tol__,
1441  double const* energy_tol__,
1442  int const* niter__,
1443  bool const* save_state__)
1444 {
1445  auto& gs = get_gs(gs_handler__);
1446  auto& ctx = gs.ctx();
1447  auto& inp = ctx.cfg().parameters();
1448  gs.initial_state();
1449 
1450  double rho_tol = inp.density_tol();
1451  if (density_tol__) {
1452  rho_tol = *density_tol__;
1453  }
1454 
1455  double etol = inp.energy_tol();
1456  if (energy_tol__) {
1457  etol = *energy_tol__;
1458  }
1459 
1460  int niter = inp.num_dft_iter();
1461  if (niter__) {
1462  niter = *niter__;
1463  }
1464 
1465  bool save{false};
1466  if (save_state__ != nullptr) {
1467  save = *save_state__;
1468  }
1469 
1470  auto result = gs.find(rho_tol, etol, ctx.iterative_solver_tolerance(), niter, save);
1471 }

1497 /*
1498 @api begin
1499 sirius_find_ground_state_robust:
1500  doc: Find the ground state using the robust
1501  arguments:
1502  gs_handler:
1503  type: void*
1504  attr: in, required
1505  doc: Handler of the ground state.
1506  ks_handler:
1507  type: void*
1508  attr: in, required
1509  doc: Handler of the k-point set.
1510  scf_density_tol:
1511  type: double
1512  attr: in, optional
1513  doc: Tolerance on RMS in density.
1514  scf_energy_tol:
1515  type: double
1516  attr: in, optional
1517  doc: Tolerance in total energy difference.
1518  scf_ninit__:
1519  type: int
1520  attr: in, optional
1521  doc: Number of SCF iterations.
1522  temp__:
1523  type: double
1524  attr: in, optional
1525  doc: Temperature.
1526  tol__:
1527  type: double
1528  attr: in, optional
1529  doc: Tolerance.
1530  cg_restart__:
1531  type: int
1532  attr: in, optional
1533  doc: CG restart.
1534  kappa__:
1535  type: double
1536  attr: in, optional
1537  doc: Scalar preconditioner for pseudo Hamiltonian
1538 @api end
1539 */
1540 void sirius_find_ground_state_robust(void* const* gs_handler__,
1541  void* const* ks_handler__,
1542  double const* scf_density_tol__,
1543  double const* scf_energy_tol__,
1544  int const* scf_ninit__,
1545  double const* temp__,
1546  double const* tol__
1547  )
1548 {
1549 #ifdef SIRIUS_NLCGLIB
1550  auto& gs = get_gs(gs_handler__);
1551  auto& ctx = gs.ctx();
1552  auto& inp = ctx.parameters_input();
1553  gs.initial_state();
1554 
1555  double rho_tol = inp.density_tol_;
1556  if (scf_density_tol__) {
1557  rho_tol = *scf_density_tol__;
1558  }
1559 
1560  double etol = inp.energy_tol_;
1561  if (scf_energy_tol__) {
1562  etol = *scf_energy_tol__;
1563  }
1564 
1565  int niter = inp.num_dft_iter_;
1566  if (scf_ninit__) {
1567  niter = *scf_ninit__;
1568  }
1569 
1570  // do a couple of SCF iterations to obtain a good initial guess
1571  bool save_state = false;
1572  auto result = gs.find(rho_tol, etol, ctx.iterative_solver_tolerance(), niter, save_state);
1573 
1574  // now call the direct solver
1575  // call nlcg solver
1576  auto& potential = gs.potential();
1577  auto& density = gs.density();
1578 
1579  auto& kset = get_ks(ks_handler__);
1580 
1581  auto nlcg_params = ctx.nlcg_input();
1582  double temp = nlcg_params.T_;
1583  double tol = nlcg_params.tol_;
1584  double kappa = nlcg_params.kappa_;
1585  double tau = nlcg_params.tau_;
1586  int maxiter = nlcg_params.maxiter_;
1587  int restart = nlcg_params.restart_;
1588  std::string smear = nlcg_params.smearing_;
1589  std::string pu = nlcg_params.processing_unit_;
1590 
1591  nlcglib::smearing_type smearing;
1592  if (smear.compare("FD") == 0) {
1593  smearing = nlcglib::smearing_type::FERMI_DIRAC;
1594  } else if (smear.compare("GS") == 0) {
1595  smearing = nlcglib::smearing_type::GAUSSIAN_SPLINE;
1596  } else {
1597  throw std::runtime_error("invalid smearing type given");
1598  }
1599 
1600  sirius::Energy energy(kset, density, potential);
1601  if (is_device_memory(ctx.preferred_memory_t())) {
1602  if (pu.empty() || pu.compare("gpu") == 0) {
1603  nlcglib::nlcg_mvp2_device(energy, smearing, temp, tol, kappa, tau, maxiter, restart);
1604  } else if (pu.compare("cpu") == 0) {
1605  nlcglib::nlcg_mvp2_device_cpu(energy, smearing, temp, tol, kappa, tau, maxiter, restart);
1606  } else {
1607  throw std::runtime_error("invalid processing unit for nlcg given: " + pu);
1608  }
1609  } else {
1610  if (pu.empty() || pu.compare("gpu") == 0) {
1611  nlcglib::nlcg_mvp2_cpu(energy, smearing, temp, tol, kappa, tau, maxiter, restart);
1612  } else if (pu.compare("cpu") == 0) {
1613  nlcglib::nlcg_mvp2_cpu_device(energy, smearing, temp, tol, kappa, tau, maxiter, restart);
1614  } else {
1615  throw std::runtime_error("invalid processing unit for nlcg given: " + pu);
1616  }
1617  }
1618 #else
1619  throw std::runtime_error("SIRIUS was not compiled with NLCG option.");
1620 #endif
1621 
1622 }

1644 sirius_add_atom_type:

1646  arguments:

1649  attr: in, required
1650  doc: Simulation context handler.
1651  label:
1652  type: string

1656  type: string

1664  type: string

1668  type: double
1669  attr: in, optional
1670  doc: Atomic mass.

1672  type: bool

1675  error_code:
1676  type: int
1677  attr: out, optional
1678  doc: Error code.
1679 @api end
1680 */
1681 void sirius_add_atom_type(void* const* handler__, char const* label__, char const* fname__, int const* zn__,
1682  char const* symbol__, double const* mass__, bool const* spin_orbit__, int* error_code__)

1690  sim_ctx.unit_cell().add_atom_type(label, fname);

1693  if (zn__ != nullptr) {
1694  type.set_zn(*zn__);
1695  }
1696  if (symbol__ != nullptr) {
1697  type.set_symbol(std::string(symbol__));
1698  }
1699  if (mass__ != nullptr) {
1700  type.set_mass(*mass__);
1701  }
1702  if (spin_orbit__ != nullptr) {
1703  type.spin_orbit_coupling(*spin_orbit__);
1704  }
1705  return 0;
1706  }, error_code__);
1707 }

1777 /*
1778 @api begin
1779 sirius_add_atom_type_radial_function:
1780  doc: Add one of the radial functions.
1781  arguments:
1782  handler:
1783  type: void*
1784  attr: in, required
1785  doc: Simulation context handler.
1786  atom_type:
1787  type: string
1788  attr: in, required
1789  doc: Label of the atom type.
1790  label:
1791  type: string
1792  attr: in, required
1793  doc: Label of the radial function.
1794  rf:
1795  type: double
1796  attr: in, required, dimension(num_points)
1797  doc: Array with radial function values.
1798  num_points:
1799  type: int
1800  attr: in, required
1801  doc: Length of radial function array.
1802  n:
1803  type: int
1804  attr: in, optional
1805  doc: Orbital quantum number.
1806  l:
1807  type: int
1808  attr: in, optional
1809  doc: angular momentum.
1810  idxrf1:
1811  type: int
1812  attr: in, optional
1813  doc: First index of radial function (for Q-operator).
1814  idxrf2:
1815  type: int
1816  attr: in, optional
1817  doc: Second index of radial function (for Q-operator).
1818  occ:
1819  type: double
1820  attr: in, optional
1821  doc: Occupancy of the wave-function.
1822 @api end
1823 */
1824 void sirius_add_atom_type_radial_function(void* const* handler__,
1825  char const* atom_type__,
1826  char const* label__,
1827  double const* rf__,
1828  int const* num_points__,
1829  int const* n__,
1830  int const* l__,
1831  int const* idxrf1__,
1832  int const* idxrf2__,
1833  double const* occ__)
1834 {
1835  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
1836 
1837  auto& type = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom_type(std::string(atom_type__));
1838  std::string label(label__);
1839 
1840  if (label == "beta") { /* beta-projectors */
1841  if (l__ == nullptr) {
1842  TERMINATE("orbital quantum number must be provided for beta-projector");
1843  }
1844  type.add_beta_radial_function(*l__, std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1845  } else if (label == "ps_atomic_wf") { /* pseudo-atomic wave functions */
1846  if (l__ == nullptr) {
1847  TERMINATE("orbital quantum number must be provided for pseudo-atomic radial function");
1848  }
1849 
1850  int n = (n__) ? *n__ : -1;
1851  double occ = (occ__) ? *occ__ : 0.0;
1852  type.add_ps_atomic_wf(n, sirius::experimental::angular_momentum_quantum_number(*l__),
1853  std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__), occ);
1854  } else if (label == "ps_rho_core") {
1855  type.ps_core_charge_density(std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1856  } else if (label == "ps_rho_total") {
1857  type.ps_total_charge_density(std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1858  } else if (label == "vloc") {
1859  type.local_potential(std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1860  } else if (label == "q_aug") { /* augmentation charge */
1861  if (l__ == nullptr) {
1862  TERMINATE("orbital quantum number must be provided for augmentation charge radial function");
1863  }
1864  if (idxrf1__ == nullptr || idxrf2__ == nullptr) {
1865  TERMINATE("both radial-function indices must be provided for augmentation charge radial function");
1866  }
1867  type.add_q_radial_function(*idxrf1__, *idxrf2__, *l__, std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1868  } else if (label == "ae_paw_wf") {
1869  type.add_ae_paw_wf(std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1870  } else if (label == "ps_paw_wf") {
1871  type.add_ps_paw_wf(std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1872  } else if (label == "ae_paw_core") {
1873  type.paw_ae_core_charge_density(std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1874  } else if (label == "ae_rho") {
1875  type.free_atom_density(std::vector<double>(rf__, rf__ + *num_points__));
1876  } else {
1877  std::stringstream s;
1878  s << "wrong label of radial function: " << label__;
1879  TERMINATE(s);
1880  }
1881 }

2113  doc: True if function has to be transformed to real-space grid.
2114  ngv:
2115  type: int
2116  attr: in, optional
2117  doc: Local number of G-vectors.
2118  gvl:
2119  type: int
2120  attr: in, optional, dimension(3, *)
2121  doc: List of G-vectors in lattice coordinates (Miller indices).
2122  comm:
2123  type: int
2124  attr: in, optional
2125  doc: MPI communicator used in distribution of G-vectors
2126 @api end
2127 */
2128 void sirius_set_pw_coeffs(void* const* handler__,
2129  char const* label__,
2130  std::complex<double> const* pw_coeffs__,
2131  bool const* transform_to_rg__,
2132  int const* ngv__,
2133  int* gvl__,
2134  int const* comm__)
2135 {
2136  PROFILE("sirius_api::sirius_set_pw_coeffs");
2137 
2138  auto& gs = get_gs(handler__);
2139 
2140  std::string label(label__);
2141 
2142  if (gs.ctx().full_potential()) {
2143  if (label == "veff") {
2144  gs.potential().set_veff_pw(pw_coeffs__);
2145  } else if (label == "rm_inv") {
2146  gs.potential().set_rm_inv_pw(pw_coeffs__);
2147  } else if (label == "rm2_inv") {
2148  gs.potential().set_rm2_inv_pw(pw_coeffs__);
2149  } else {
2150  TERMINATE("wrong label");
2151  }
2152  } else {
2153  assert(ngv__ != nullptr);
2154  assert(gvl__ != nullptr);
2155  assert(comm__ != nullptr);
2156 
2157  Communicator comm(MPI_Comm_f2c(*comm__));
2158  mdarray<int, 2> gvec(gvl__, 3, *ngv__);
2159 
2160  std::vector<double_complex> v(gs.ctx().gvec().num_gvec(), 0);
2161  #pragma omp parallel for schedule(static)
2162  for (int i = 0; i < *ngv__; i++) {
2163  vector3d<int> G(gvec(0, i), gvec(1, i), gvec(2, i));
2164  //auto gvc = gs.ctx().unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors() * vector3d<double>(G[0], G[1], G[2]);
2165  //if (gvc.length() > gs.ctx().pw_cutoff()) {
2166  // continue;
2167  //}
2168  int ig = gs.ctx().gvec().index_by_gvec(G);
2169  if (ig >= 0) {
2170  v[ig] = pw_coeffs__[i];
2171  } else {
2172  if (gs.ctx().gamma_point()) {
2173  ig = gs.ctx().gvec().index_by_gvec(G * (-1));
2174  if (ig == -1) {
2175  std::stringstream s;
2176  auto gvc = dot(gs.ctx().unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors(),
2177  vector3d<double>(G[0], G[1], G[2]));
2178  s << "wrong index of G-vector" << std::endl
2179  << "input G-vector: " << G << " (length: " << gvc.length() << " [a.u.^-1])" << std::endl;
2180  TERMINATE(s);
2181  } else {
2182  v[ig] = std::conj(pw_coeffs__[i]);
2183  }
2184  }
2185  }
2186  }
2187  comm.allreduce(v.data(), gs.ctx().gvec().num_gvec());
2188 
2189  std::map<std::string, sirius::Smooth_periodic_function<double>*> func = {
2190  {"rho", &gs.density().rho()},
2191  {"rhoc", &gs.density().rho_pseudo_core()},
2192  {"magz", &gs.density().magnetization(0)},
2193  {"magx", &gs.density().magnetization(1)},
2194  {"magy", &gs.density().magnetization(2)},
2195  {"veff", &gs.potential().effective_potential()},
2196  {"bz", &gs.potential().effective_magnetic_field(0)},
2197  {"bx", &gs.potential().effective_magnetic_field(1)},
2198  {"by", &gs.potential().effective_magnetic_field(2)},
2199  {"vloc", &gs.potential().local_potential()},
2200  {"vxc", &gs.potential().xc_potential()},
2201  {"dveff", &gs.potential().dveff()},
2202  };
2203 
2204  try {
2205  func.at(label)->scatter_f_pw(v);
2206  if (transform_to_rg__ && *transform_to_rg__) {
2207  func.at(label)->fft_transform(1);
2208  }
2209  } catch(...) {
2210  TERMINATE("wrong label");
2211  }
2212  }
2213 }

2215 /*
2216 @api begin
2217 sirius_get_pw_coeffs:
2218  doc: Get plane-wave coefficients of a periodic function.
2219  arguments:
2220  handler:
2221  type: void*
2222  attr: in, required
2223  doc: Ground state handler.
2224  label:
2225  type: string
2226  attr: in, required
2227  doc: Label of the function.
2228  pw_coeffs:
2229  type: complex
2230  attr: in, required, dimension(*)
2231  doc: Local array of plane-wave coefficients.
2232  ngv:
2233  type: int
2234  attr: in, optional
2235  doc: Local number of G-vectors.
2236  gvl:
2237  type: int
2238  attr: in, optional, dimension(3, *)
2239  doc: List of G-vectors in lattice coordinates (Miller indices).
2240  comm:
2241  type: int
2242  attr: in, optional
2243  doc: MPI communicator used in distribution of G-vectors
2244 @api end
2245 */
2246 void sirius_get_pw_coeffs(void* const* handler__,
2247  char const* label__,
2248  std::complex<double>* pw_coeffs__,
2249  int const* ngv__,
2250  int* gvl__,
2251  int const* comm__)
2252 {
2253  PROFILE("sirius_api::sirius_get_pw_coeffs");
2254 
2255  auto& gs = get_gs(handler__);
2256 
2257  std::string label(label__);
2258  if (gs.ctx().full_potential()) {
2259  STOP();
2260  } else {
2261  assert(ngv__ != NULL);
2262  assert(gvl__ != NULL);
2263  assert(comm__ != NULL);
2264 
2265  Communicator comm(MPI_Comm_f2c(*comm__));
2266  mdarray<int, 2> gvec(gvl__, 3, *ngv__);
2267 
2268  std::map<std::string, sirius::Smooth_periodic_function<double>*> func = {
2269  {"rho", &gs.density().rho()},
2270  {"magz", &gs.density().magnetization(0)},
2271  {"magx", &gs.density().magnetization(1)},
2272  {"magy", &gs.density().magnetization(2)},
2273  {"veff", &gs.potential().effective_potential()},
2274  {"vloc", &gs.potential().local_potential()},
2275  {"rhoc", &gs.density().rho_pseudo_core()}
2276  };
2277 
2278  std::vector<double_complex> v;
2279  try {
2280  v = func.at(label)->gather_f_pw();
2281  } catch(...) {
2282  TERMINATE("wrong label");
2283  }
2284 
2285  for (int i = 0; i < *ngv__; i++) {
2286  vector3d<int> G(gvec(0, i), gvec(1, i), gvec(2, i));
2287 
2288  //auto gvc = gs.ctx().unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors() * vector3d<double>(G[0], G[1], G[2]);
2289  //if (gvc.length() > gs.ctx().pw_cutoff()) {
2290  // pw_coeffs__[i] = 0;
2291  // continue;
2292  //}
2293 
2294  bool is_inverse{false};
2295  int ig = gs.ctx().gvec().index_by_gvec(G);
2296  if (ig == -1 && gs.ctx().gvec().reduced()) {
2297  ig = gs.ctx().gvec().index_by_gvec(G * (-1));
2298  is_inverse = true;
2299  }
2300  if (ig == -1) {
2301  std::stringstream s;
2302  auto gvc = dot(gs.ctx().unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors(), vector3d<double>(G[0], G[1], G[2]));
2303  s << "wrong index of G-vector" << std::endl
2304  << "input G-vector: " << G << " (length: " << gvc.length() << " [a.u.^-1])" << std::endl;
2305  TERMINATE(s);
2306  }
2307  if (is_inverse) {
2308  pw_coeffs__[i] = std::conj(v[ig]);
2309  } else {
2310  pw_coeffs__[i] = v[ig];
2311  }
2312  }
2313  }
2314 }

2316 /*
2317 @api begin
2318 sirius_get_pw_coeffs_real:
2319  doc: Get atom type contribution to plane-wave coefficients of a periodic function.
2320  arguments:
2321  handler:
2322  type: void*
2323  attr: in, required
2324  doc: Simulation context handler.
2325  atom_type:
2326  type: string
2327  attr: in, required
2328  doc: Label of the atom type.
2329  label:
2330  type: string
2331  attr: in, required
2332  doc: Label of the function.
2333  pw_coeffs:
2334  type: double
2335  attr: out, required, dimension(*)
2336  doc: Local array of plane-wave coefficients.
2337  ngv:
2338  type: int
2339  attr: in, optional
2340  doc: Local number of G-vectors.
2341  gvl:
2342  type: int
2343  attr: in, optional, dimension(3, *)
2344  doc: List of G-vectors in lattice coordinates (Miller indices).
2345  comm:
2346  type: int
2347  attr: in, optional
2348  doc: MPI communicator used in distribution of G-vectors
2349 @api end
2350 */
2351 void sirius_get_pw_coeffs_real(void* const* handler__,
2352  char const* atom_type__,
2353  char const* label__,
2354  double* pw_coeffs__,
2355  int const* ngv__,
2356  int* gvl__,
2357  int const* comm__)
2358 {
2359  PROFILE("sirius_api::sirius_get_pw_coeffs_real");
2360 
2361  std::string label(label__);
2362  std::string atom_label(atom_type__);
2363  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
2364 
2365  int iat = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom_type(atom_label).id();
2366 
2367  auto make_pw_coeffs = [&](std::function<double(double)> f)
2368  {
2369  mdarray<int, 2> gvec(gvl__, 3, *ngv__);
2370 
2371  double fourpi_omega = fourpi / sim_ctx.unit_cell().omega();
2372  #pragma omp parallel for schedule(static)
2373  for (int i = 0; i < *ngv__; i++) {
2374  auto gc = dot(sim_ctx.unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors(),
2375  vector3d<int>(gvec(0, i), gvec(1, i), gvec(2, i)));
2376  pw_coeffs__[i] = fourpi_omega * f(gc.length());
2377  }
2378  };
2379 
2380  if (label == "rhoc") {
2381  make_pw_coeffs([&](double g)
2382  {
2383  return sim_ctx.ps_core_ri().value<int>(iat, g);
2384  });
2385  } else if (label == "rhoc_dg") {
2386  make_pw_coeffs([&](double g)
2387  {
2388  return sim_ctx.ps_core_ri_djl().value<int>(iat, g);
2389  });
2390  } else if (label == "vloc") {
2391  make_pw_coeffs([&](double g)
2392  {
2393  return sim_ctx.vloc_ri().value(iat, g);
2394  });
2395  } else if (label == "rho") {
2396  make_pw_coeffs([&](double g)
2397  {
2398  return sim_ctx.ps_rho_ri().value<int>(iat, g);
2399  });
2400  } else {
2401  std::stringstream s;
2402  s << "[sirius_get_pw_coeffs_real] wrong label" << std::endl
2403  << " label : " << label;
2404  TERMINATE(s);
2405  }
2406 }

2432 /*
2433 @api begin
2434 sirius_find_eigen_states:
2435  doc: Find eigen-states of the Hamiltonian
2436  arguments:
2437  gs_handler:
2438  type: void*
2439  attr: in, required
2440  doc: Ground state handler.
2441  ks_handler:
2442  type: void*
2443  attr: in, required
2444  doc: K-point set handler.
2445  precompute_pw:
2446  type: bool
2447  attr: in, optional
2448  doc: Generate plane-wave coefficients of the potential
2449  precompute_rf:
2450  type: bool
2451  attr: in, optional
2452  doc: Generate radial functions
2453  precompute_ri:
2454  type: bool
2455  attr: in, optional
2456  doc: Generate radial integrals
2457  iter_solver_tol:
2458  type: double
2459  attr: in, optional
2460  doc: Iterative solver tolerance.
2461  error_code:
2462  type: int
2463  attr: out, optional
2464  doc: Error code.
2465 @api end
2466 */
2467 void sirius_find_eigen_states(void* const* gs_handler__, void* const* ks_handler__, bool const* precompute_pw__,
2468  bool const* precompute_rf__, bool const* precompute_ri__, double const* iter_solver_tol__, int* error_code__)
2469 {
2470  call_sirius([&]()
2471  {
2472  auto& gs = get_gs(gs_handler__);
2473  auto& ks = get_ks(ks_handler__);
2474  if (iter_solver_tol__ != nullptr) {
2475  ks.ctx().iterative_solver_tolerance(*iter_solver_tol__);
2476  }
2477  sirius::Hamiltonian0 H0(gs.potential());
2478  if (precompute_pw__ && *precompute_pw__) {
2479  H0.potential().generate_pw_coefs();
2480  }
2481  if ((precompute_rf__ && *precompute_rf__) || (precompute_ri__ && *precompute_ri__)) {
2482  H0.potential().update_atomic_potential();
2483  }
2484  if (precompute_rf__ && *precompute_rf__) {
2485  const_cast<sirius::Unit_cell&>(gs.ctx().unit_cell()).generate_radial_functions();
2486  }
2487  if (precompute_ri__ && *precompute_ri__) {
2488  const_cast<sirius::Unit_cell&>(gs.ctx().unit_cell()).generate_radial_integrals();
2489  }
2490  sirius::Band(ks.ctx()).solve(ks, H0, false);
2491  }, error_code__);
2492 }

2685 /*
2686 @api begin
2687 sirius_get_d_operator_matrix:
2688  doc: Get D-operator matrix
2689  arguments:
2690  handler:
2691  type: void*
2692  attr: in, required
2693  doc: Simulation context handler.
2694  ia:
2695  type: int
2696  attr: in, required
2697  doc: Global index of atom.
2698  ispn:
2699  type: int
2700  attr: in, required
2701  doc: Spin component.
2702  d_mtrx:
2703  type: double
2704  attr: out, required, dimension(ld, ld)
2705  doc: D-matrix.
2706  ld:
2707  type: int
2708  attr: in, required
2709  doc: Leading dimension of D-matrix.
2710 @api end
2711 */
2712 void sirius_get_d_operator_matrix(void* const* handler__,
2713  int const* ia__,
2714  int const* ispn__,
2715  double* d_mtrx__,
2716  int const* ld__)
2717 {
2718  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
2719 
2720  mdarray<double, 2> d_mtrx(d_mtrx__, *ld__, *ld__);
2721 
2722  auto& atom = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(*ia__ - 1);
2723  auto idx_map = atomic_orbital_index_map_QE(atom.type());
2724  int nbf = atom.mt_basis_size();
2725 
2726  d_mtrx.zero();
2727 
2728  for (int xi1 = 0; xi1 < nbf; xi1++) {
2729  int p1 = phase_Rlm_QE(atom.type(), xi1);
2730  for (int xi2 = 0; xi2 < nbf; xi2++) {
2731  int p2 = phase_Rlm_QE(atom.type(), xi2);
2732  d_mtrx(idx_map[xi1], idx_map[xi2]) = atom.d_mtrx(xi1, xi2, *ispn__ - 1) * p1 * p2;
2733  }
2734  }
2735 }

2744  attr: in, required
2745  doc: Simulation context handler.
2746  ia:

2748  attr: in, required
2749  doc: Global index of atom.

2754  d_mtrx:
2755  type: double
2756  attr: out, required
2757  doc: D-matrix.
2758  ld:
2759  type: int
2760  attr: in, required

2782  atom.d_mtrx(xi1, xi2, *ispn__ - 1) = d_mtrx(idx_map[xi1], idx_map[xi2]) * p1 * p2;
2783  }

2902 void sirius_get_density_matrix(void* const* handler__,
2903  int const* ia__,
2904  std::complex<double>* dm__,
2905  int const* ld__) // TODO: this should be generalized for any phase factor convention
2906 {

2908 
2909  mdarray<double_complex, 3> dm(dm__, *ld__, *ld__, 3);
2910 
2911  auto& atom = gs.ctx().unit_cell().atom(*ia__ - 1);
2912  if (gs.ctx().full_potential()) {
2913  int nbf = std::min(atom.mt_basis_size(), *ld__);
2914  for (int icomp = 0; icomp < gs.ctx().num_mag_comp(); icomp++) {
2915  for (int i = 0; i < nbf; i++) {
2916  for (int j = 0; j < nbf; j++) {
2917  dm(i, j, icomp) = gs.density().density_matrix()(i, j, icomp, *ia__ - 1);
2918  }
2919  }
2920  }
2921  } else {
2922  auto idx_map = atomic_orbital_index_map_QE(atom.type());
2923  int nbf = atom.mt_basis_size();
2924  assert(nbf <= *ld__);
2925 
2926  for (int icomp = 0; icomp < gs.ctx().num_mag_comp(); icomp++) {
2927  for (int i = 0; i < nbf; i++) {
2928  int p1 = phase_Rlm_QE(atom.type(), i);
2929  for (int j = 0; j < nbf; j++) {
2930  int p2 = phase_Rlm_QE(atom.type(), j);
2931  dm(idx_map[i], idx_map[j], icomp) = gs.density().density_matrix()(i, j, icomp, *ia__ - 1) * static_cast<double>(p1 * p2);
2932  }
2933  }
2934  }
2935  }
2936 }

3205 /*
3206 @api begin
3207 sirius_get_q_operator:
3208  doc: Get plane-wave coefficients of Q-operator
3209  arguments:
3210  handler:
3211  type: void*
3212  attr: in, required
3213  doc: Simulation context handler.
3214  label:
3215  type: string
3216  attr: in, required
3217  doc: Label of the atom type.
3218  xi1:
3219  type: int
3220  attr: in, required
3221  doc: First index of beta-projector atomic function.
3222  xi2:
3223  type: int
3224  attr: in, required
3225  doc: Second index of beta-projector atomic function.
3226  ngv:
3227  type: int
3228  attr: in, required
3229  doc: Number of G-vectors.
3230  gvl:
3231  type: int
3232  attr: in, required, dimension(3, ngv)
3233  doc: G-vectors in lattice coordinats.
3234  q_pw:
3235  type: complex
3236  attr: out, required, dimension(ngv)
3237  doc: Plane-wave coefficients of Q augmentation operator.
3238 @api end
3239 */
3240 void sirius_get_q_operator(void* const* handler__,
3241  char const* label__,
3242  int const* xi1__,
3243  int const* xi2__,
3244  int const* ngv__,
3245  int* gvl__,
3246  std::complex<double>* q_pw__)
3247 {
3248  PROFILE("sirius_api::sirius_get_q_operator");
3249 
3250  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
3251 
3252  auto& type = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom_type(std::string(label__));
3253 
3254  mdarray<int, 2> gvl(gvl__, 3, *ngv__);
3255 
3256  auto qe_order = atomic_orbital_index_map_QE(type);
3257 
3258  int xi1{-1};
3259  int xi2{-1};
3260 
3261  /* find sirius indices, corresponding to QE indices */
3262  for (int xi = 0; xi < type.mt_basis_size(); xi++) {
3263  if (qe_order[xi] == (*xi1__ - 1)) {
3264  xi1 = xi;
3265  }
3266  if (qe_order[xi] == (*xi2__ - 1)) {
3267  xi2 = xi;
3268  }
3269  }
3270 
3271  auto p1 = phase_Rlm_QE(type, xi1);
3272  auto p2 = phase_Rlm_QE(type, xi2);
3273 
3274  int idx = utils::packed_index(xi1, xi2);
3275 
3276  std::vector<double_complex> q_pw(sim_ctx.gvec().num_gvec());
3277  for (int ig = 0; ig < sim_ctx.gvec().count(); ig++) {
3278  double x = sim_ctx.augmentation_op(type.id())->q_pw(idx, 2 * ig);
3279  double y = sim_ctx.augmentation_op(type.id())->q_pw(idx, 2 * ig + 1);
3280  q_pw[sim_ctx.gvec().offset() + ig] = double_complex(x, y) * static_cast<double>(p1 * p2);
3281  }
3282  sim_ctx.comm().allgather(q_pw.data(), sim_ctx.gvec().count(), sim_ctx.gvec().offset());
3283 
3284  for (int i = 0; i < *ngv__; i++) {
3285  vector3d<int> G(gvl(0, i), gvl(1, i), gvl(2, i));
3286 
3287  auto gvc = dot(sim_ctx.unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors(), vector3d<double>(G[0], G[1], G[2]));
3288  if (gvc.length() > sim_ctx.pw_cutoff()) {
3289  q_pw__[i] = 0;
3290  continue;
3291  }
3292 
3293  bool is_inverse{false};
3294  int ig = sim_ctx.gvec().index_by_gvec(G);
3295  if (ig == -1 && sim_ctx.gvec().reduced()) {
3296  ig = sim_ctx.gvec().index_by_gvec(G * (-1));
3297  is_inverse = true;
3298  }
3299  if (ig == -1) {
3300  std::stringstream s;
3301  auto gvc = dot(sim_ctx.unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors(), vector3d<double>(G[0], G[1], G[2]));
3302  s << "wrong index of G-vector" << std::endl
3303  << "input G-vector: " << G << " (length: " << gvc.length() << " [a.u.^-1])" << std::endl;
3304  TERMINATE(s);
3305  } else {
3306  if (is_inverse) {
3307  q_pw__[i] = std::conj(q_pw[ig]);
3308  } else {
3309  q_pw__[i] = q_pw[ig];
3310  }
3311  }
3312  }
3313 }

3315 /*

3354 void sirius_get_wave_functions(void* const* ks_handler__,

3357  int const* npw__,

3359  std::complex<double>* evc__,

3364 
3365  auto& ks = get_ks(ks_handler__);
3366 
3367  auto& kset = ks;
3368  auto& sim_ctx = kset.ctx();
3369 
3370  int jk = *ik__ - 1;
3371  int jspn = *ispn__ - 1;
3372 
3373  int jrank{-1};
3374  if (jk >= 0) {
3375  /* find the rank where this k-point is stored */
3376  jrank = kset.spl_num_kpoints().local_rank(jk);
3377  }
3378 
3379  std::vector<int> rank_with_jk(kset.comm().size());
3380  kset.comm().allgather(&jrank, rank_with_jk.data(), 1, kset.comm().rank());
3381 
3382  std::vector<int> jk_of_rank(kset.comm().size());
3383  kset.comm().allgather(&jk, jk_of_rank.data(), 1, kset.comm().rank());
3384 
3385  std::vector<int> jspn_of_rank(kset.comm().size());
3386  kset.comm().allgather(&jspn, jspn_of_rank.data(), 1, kset.comm().rank());
3387 
3388  int my_rank = kset.comm().rank();
3389 
3390  std::vector<int> igmap;
3391 
3392  auto gvec_mapping = [&](Gvec const& gkvec)
3393  {
3394  std::vector<int> igm(*npw__, std::numeric_limits<int>::max());
3395 
3396  mdarray<int, 2> gvec_k(gvec_k__, 3, *npw__);
3397 
3398  for (int ig = 0; ig < *npw__; ig++) {
3399  /* G vector of host code */
3400  auto gvc = dot(kset.ctx().unit_cell().reciprocal_lattice_vectors(),
3401  (vector3d<double>(gvec_k(0, ig), gvec_k(1, ig), gvec_k(2, ig)) + gkvec.vk()));
3402  if (gvc.length() > kset.ctx().gk_cutoff()) {
3403  continue;
3404  }
3405  int ig1 = gkvec.index_by_gvec({gvec_k(0, ig), gvec_k(1, ig), gvec_k(2, ig)});
3406  /* vector is out of bounds */
3407  if (ig1 >= gkvec.num_gvec()) {
3408  continue;
3409  }
3410  /* index of G was not found */
3411  if (ig1 < 0) {
3412  /* try -G */
3413  ig1 = gkvec.index_by_gvec({-gvec_k(0, ig), -gvec_k(1, ig), -gvec_k(2, ig)});
3414  /* index of -G was not found */
3415  if (ig1 < 0) {
3416  continue;
3417  } else {
3418  /* this will tell co conjugate PW coefficients as we take them from -G index */
3419  igm[ig] = -ig1;
3420  }
3421  } else {
3422  igm[ig] = ig1;
3423  }
3424  }
3425  return igm;
3426  };
3427 
3428  auto store_wf = [&](std::vector<double_complex>& wf_tmp, int i, int s, mdarray<double_complex, 3>& evc)
3429  {
3430  int ispn = s;
3431  if (sim_ctx.num_mag_dims() == 1) {
3432  ispn = 0;
3433  }
3434  for (int ig = 0; ig < *npw__; ig++) {
3435  int ig1 = igmap[ig];
3436  /* if this is a valid index */
3437  if (ig1 != std::numeric_limits<int>::max()) {
3438  double_complex z;
3439  if (ig1 < 0) {
3440  z = std::conj(wf_tmp[-ig1]);
3441  } else {
3442  z = wf_tmp[ig1];
3443  }
3444  evc(ig, ispn, i) = z;
3445  }
3446  }
3447  };
3448 
3449  for (int r = 0; r < kset.comm().size(); r++) {
3450  /* index of k-point we need to pass */
3451  int this_jk = jk_of_rank[r];
3452 
3453  if (this_jk >= 0) {
3454  auto gkvec = kset.send_recv_gkvec(this_jk, r);
3455 
3456  /* if this is a rank witch needs jk or a rank which stores jk */
3457  if (my_rank == r || my_rank == rank_with_jk[r]) {
3458 
3459  /* build G-vector mapping */
3460  if (my_rank == r) {
3461  igmap = gvec_mapping(gkvec);
3462  }
3463 
3464  /* target array of wave-functions */
3465  mdarray<double_complex, 3> evc;
3466  if (my_rank == r) {
3467  /* [npwx, npol, nbnd] array dimensions */
3468  evc = mdarray<double_complex, 3>(evc__, *ld1__, *ld2__, sim_ctx.num_bands());
3469  evc.zero();
3470  }
3471 
3472  std::unique_ptr<Gvec_partition> gvp;
3473  std::unique_ptr<Wave_functions> wf;
3474 
3475  if (my_rank == r) {
3476  gvp = std::unique_ptr<Gvec_partition>(
3477  new Gvec_partition(gkvec, sim_ctx.comm_fft_coarse(), sim_ctx.comm_band_ortho_fft_coarse()));
3478  wf = std::unique_ptr<Wave_functions>(
3479  new Wave_functions(*gvp, sim_ctx.num_bands(), sim_ctx.preferred_memory_t()));
3480  }
3481 
3482  int ispn0{0};
3483  int ispn1{1};
3484  /* fetch two components in non-collinear case, otherwise fetch only one component */
3485  if (sim_ctx.num_mag_dims() != 3) {
3486  ispn0 = ispn1 = jspn_of_rank[r];
3487  }
3488  /* send wave-functions for each spin channel */
3489  for (int s = ispn0; s <= ispn1; s++) {
3490  int tag = Communicator::get_tag(r, rank_with_jk[r]) + s;
3491  Request req;
3492 
3493  /* make a check of send-receive sizes */
3494  if (true) {
3495  int send_size;
3496  int send_size1;
3497  if (my_rank == rank_with_jk[r]) {
3498  auto kp = kset[this_jk];
3499  int gkvec_count = kp->gkvec().count();
3500  send_size = gkvec_count * sim_ctx.num_bands();
3501  req = kset.comm().isend(&send_size, 1, r, tag);
3502  }
3503  if (my_rank == r) {
3504  int gkvec_count = gkvec.count();
3505  kset.comm().recv(&send_size1, 1, rank_with_jk[r], tag);
3506  if (send_size1 != gkvec_count * sim_ctx.num_bands()) {
3507  std::stringstream s;
3508  s << "wrong send-receive buffer sizes\n"
3509  << " send size : " << send_size1 << "\n"
3510  << " receive size : " << gkvec_count * sim_ctx.num_bands() << "\n"
3511  << " number of bands : " << sim_ctx.num_bands();
3512  TERMINATE(s);
3513  }
3514  }
3515  if (my_rank == rank_with_jk[r]) {
3516  req.wait();
3517  }
3518  }
3519 
3520  if (my_rank == rank_with_jk[r]) {
3521  auto kp = kset[this_jk];
3522  int gkvec_count = kp->gkvec().count();
3523  /* send wave-functions */
3524  req = kset.comm().isend(&kp->spinor_wave_functions().pw_coeffs(s).prime(0, 0),
3525  gkvec_count * sim_ctx.num_bands(), r, tag);
3526  }
3527  if (my_rank == r) {
3528  int gkvec_count = gkvec.count();
3529  int gkvec_offset = gkvec.offset();
3530  /* receive the array with wave-functions */
3531  kset.comm().recv(&wf->pw_coeffs(0).prime(0, 0), gkvec_count * sim_ctx.num_bands(),
3532  rank_with_jk[r], tag);
3533  std::vector<double_complex> wf_tmp(gkvec.num_gvec());
3534  /* store wave-functions */
3535  for (int i = 0; i < sim_ctx.num_bands(); i++) {
3536  /* gather full column of PW coefficients */
3537  sim_ctx.comm_band().allgather(&wf->pw_coeffs(0).prime(0, i), wf_tmp.data(),
3538  gkvec_count, gkvec_offset);
3539  store_wf(wf_tmp, i, s, evc);
3540  }
3541  }
3542  if (my_rank == rank_with_jk[r]) {
3543  req.wait();
3544  }
3545  }
3546  }
3547  }
3548  }
3549 }

3801 /*
3802 @api begin
3803 sirius_generate_coulomb_potential:
3804  doc: Generate Coulomb potential by solving Poisson equation
3805  arguments:
3806  handler:
3807  type: void*
3808  attr: in, required
3809  doc: DFT ground state handler
3810  vclmt:
3811  type: double
3812  attr: out, optional
3813  doc: Muffin-tin part of Coulomb potential
3814  lmmax:
3815  type: int
3816  attr: in, optional
3817  doc: Number of spherical harmonics
3818  max_num_mt_points:
3819  type: int
3820  attr: in, optional
3821  doc: Maximum number of muffin-tin points
3822  num_atoms:
3823  type: int
3824  attr: in, optional
3825  doc: Number of atoms
3826  vha_el:
3827  type: double
3828  attr: out, optional
3829  doc: Electronic part of Hartree potential at each atom's origin.
3830  vclrg:
3831  type: double
3832  attr: out, optional
3833  doc: Interstitital part of the Coulomb potential
3834  num_rg_points:
3835  type: int
3836  attr: out, optional
3837  doc: Error code
3838 @api end
3839 */
3840 void sirius_generate_coulomb_potential(void* const* handler__, double* vclmt__, int const* lmmax__,
3841  int const* max_num_mt_points__, int const* num_atoms__, double* vha_el__, double* vclrg__,
3842  int const* num_rg_points__, int* error_code__)
3843 {
3844  call_sirius([&]()
3845  {
3846  auto& gs = get_gs(handler__);
3847 
3848  gs.density().rho().fft_transform(-1);
3849  gs.potential().poisson(gs.density().rho());
3850 
3851  if (vclmt__) {
3852  if (!lmmax__) {
3853  throw std::runtime_error("missing 'lmmax' argument");
3854  }
3855  if (*lmmax__ != gs.potential().hartree_potential().angular_domain_size()) {
3856  throw std::runtime_error("wrong number of spherical harmonics");
3857  }
3858  if (!max_num_mt_points__) {
3859  throw std::runtime_error("missing 'max_num_mt_points' argument");
3860  }
3861  if (*max_num_mt_points__ != gs.ctx().unit_cell().max_num_mt_points()) {
3862  throw std::runtime_error("wrong maximum number of muffin-tin radial points");
3863  }
3864  if (!num_atoms__) {
3865  throw std::runtime_error("missing `num_atoms' argument");
3866  }
3867  if (*num_atoms__ != gs.ctx().unit_cell().num_atoms()) {
3868  throw std::runtime_error("wrong number of atoms");
3869  }
3870  gs.potential().hartree_potential().copy_to(vclmt__, nullptr, false);
3871  if (vha_el__) {
3872  for (int ia = 0; ia < gs.ctx().unit_cell().num_atoms(); ia++) {
3873  vha_el__[ia] = gs.potential().vha_el(ia);
3874  }
3875  }
3876  }
3877 
3878  if (vclrg__) {
3879  if (!num_rg_points__) {
3880  throw std::runtime_error("missing 'num_rg_points' argument");
3881  }
3882  bool is_local_rg;
3883  if (gs.ctx().fft_grid().num_points() == *num_rg_points__) {
3884  is_local_rg = false;
3885  } else if (static_cast<int>(spfft_grid_size(gs.ctx().spfft())) == *num_rg_points__) {
3886  is_local_rg = true;
3887  } else {
3888  throw std::runtime_error("wrong number of regular grid points");
3889  }
3890  gs.potential().hartree_potential().copy_to(nullptr, vclrg__, is_local_rg);
3891  }
3892  }, error_code__);
3893 }

3942 void sirius_generate_xc_potential(void* const* handler__,

3957 
3958  if (gs.ctx().num_mag_dims() == 1) {
3959  /* z component */
3960  gs.potential().effective_magnetic_field(0).copy_to(bxcmt_z__, bxcrg_z__, *is_local_rg__);
3961  }
3962  if (gs.ctx().num_mag_dims() == 3) {
3963  /* z component */
3964  gs.potential().effective_magnetic_field(0).copy_to(bxcmt_z__, bxcrg_z__, *is_local_rg__);
3965  /* x component */
3966  gs.potential().effective_magnetic_field(1).copy_to(bxcmt_x__, bxcrg_x__, *is_local_rg__);
3967  /* y component */
3968  gs.potential().effective_magnetic_field(2).copy_to(bxcmt_y__, bxcrg_y__, *is_local_rg__);

4066 // TODO: add dimensions keyword to the argument properties
4067 /*
4068 @api begin
4069 sirius_get_gvec_arrays:
4070  doc: Get G-vector arrays.
4071  arguments:
4072  handler:
4073  type: void*
4074  attr: in, required
4075  doc: Simulation context handler
4076  gvec:
4077  type: int
4078  attr: in, optional, dimension(3, *)
4079  doc: G-vectors in lattice coordinates.
4080  gvec_cart:
4081  type: double
4082  attr: in, optional, dimension(3, *)
4083  doc: G-vectors in Cartesian coordinates.
4084  gvec_len:
4085  type: double
4086  attr: in, optional, dimension(*)
4087  doc: Length of G-vectors.
4088  index_by_gvec:
4089  type: int
4090  attr: in, optional
4091  doc: G-vector index by lattice coordinates.
4092 @api end
4093 */
4094 void sirius_get_gvec_arrays(void* const* handler__,
4095  int* gvec__,
4096  double* gvec_cart__,
4097  double* gvec_len__,
4098  int* index_by_gvec__)
4099 {
4100  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
4101 
4102  if (gvec__ != nullptr) {
4103  mdarray<int, 2> gvec(gvec__, 3, sim_ctx.gvec().num_gvec());
4104  for (int ig = 0; ig < sim_ctx.gvec().num_gvec(); ig++) {
4105  auto gv = sim_ctx.gvec().gvec(ig);
4106  for (int x: {0, 1, 2}) {
4107  gvec(x, ig) = gv[x];
4108  }
4109  }
4110  }
4111  if (gvec_cart__ != nullptr) {
4112  mdarray<double, 2> gvec_cart(gvec_cart__, 3, sim_ctx.gvec().num_gvec());
4113  for (int ig = 0; ig < sim_ctx.gvec().num_gvec(); ig++) {
4114  auto gvc = sim_ctx.gvec().gvec_cart<index_domain_t::global>(ig);
4115  for (int x: {0, 1, 2}) {
4116  gvec_cart(x, ig) = gvc[x];
4117  }
4118  }
4119  }
4120  if (gvec_len__ != nullptr) {
4121  for (int ig = 0; ig < sim_ctx.gvec().num_gvec(); ig++) {
4122  gvec_len__[ig] = sim_ctx.gvec().gvec_len(ig);
4123  }
4124  }
4125  if (index_by_gvec__ != nullptr) {
4126  auto d0 = sim_ctx.fft_grid().limits(0);
4127  auto d1 = sim_ctx.fft_grid().limits(1);
4128  auto d2 = sim_ctx.fft_grid().limits(2);
4129 
4130  sddk::mdarray<int, 3> index_by_gvec(index_by_gvec__, d0, d1, d2);
4131  std::fill(index_by_gvec.at(memory_t::host), index_by_gvec.at(memory_t::host) + index_by_gvec.size(), -1);
4132 
4133  for (int ig = 0; ig < sim_ctx.gvec().num_gvec(); ig++) {
4134  auto G = sim_ctx.gvec().gvec(ig);
4135  index_by_gvec(G[0], G[1], G[2]) = ig + 1;
4136  }
4137  }
4138 }

4227 /*
4228 @api begin
4229 sirius_get_gkvec_arrays:
4230  doc: Get all G+k vector related arrays
4231  arguments:
4232  ks_handler:
4233  type: void*
4234  attr: in, required
4235  doc: K-point set handler.
4236  ik:
4237  type: int
4238  attr: in, required
4239  doc: Global index of k-point
4240  num_gkvec:
4241  type: int
4242  attr: out, required
4243  doc: Number of G+k vectors.
4244  gvec_index:
4245  type: int
4246  attr: out, required
4247  doc: Index of the G-vector part of G+k vector.
4248  gkvec:
4249  type: double
4250  attr: out, required
4251  doc: G+k vectors in fractional coordinates.
4252  gkvec_cart:
4253  type: double
4254  attr: out, required
4255  doc: G+k vectors in Cartesian coordinates.
4256  gkvec_len:
4257  type: double
4258  attr: out, required
4259  doc: Length of G+k vectors.
4260  gkvec_tp:
4261  type: double
4262  attr: out, required
4263  doc: Theta and Phi angles of G+k vectors.
4264 @api end
4265 */
4266 void sirius_get_gkvec_arrays(void* const* ks_handler__,
4267  int* ik__,
4268  int* num_gkvec__,
4269  int* gvec_index__,
4270  double* gkvec__,
4271  double* gkvec_cart__,
4272  double* gkvec_len,
4273  double* gkvec_tp__)
4274 {
4275 
4276  auto& ks = get_ks(ks_handler__);
4277 
4278  auto kp = ks[*ik__ - 1];
4279 
4280  /* get rank that stores a given k-point */
4281  int rank = ks.spl_num_kpoints().local_rank(*ik__ - 1);
4282 
4283  auto& comm_k = ks.ctx().comm_k();
4284 
4285  if (rank == comm_k.rank()) {
4286  *num_gkvec__ = kp->num_gkvec();
4287  mdarray<double, 2> gkvec(gkvec__, 3, kp->num_gkvec());
4288  mdarray<double, 2> gkvec_cart(gkvec_cart__, 3, kp->num_gkvec());
4289  mdarray<double, 2> gkvec_tp(gkvec_tp__, 2, kp->num_gkvec());
4290 
4291  for (int igk = 0; igk < kp->num_gkvec(); igk++) {
4292  auto gkc = kp->gkvec().gkvec_cart<index_domain_t::global>(igk);
4293  auto G = kp->gkvec().gvec(igk);
4294 
4295  gvec_index__[igk] = ks.ctx().gvec().index_by_gvec(G) + 1; // Fortran counts from 1
4296  for (int x: {0, 1, 2}) {
4297  gkvec(x, igk) = kp->gkvec().gkvec(igk)[x];
4298  gkvec_cart(x, igk) = gkc[x];
4299  }
4300  auto rtp = sirius::SHT::spherical_coordinates(gkc);
4301  gkvec_len[igk] = rtp[0];
4302  gkvec_tp(0, igk) = rtp[1];
4303  gkvec_tp(1, igk) = rtp[2];
4304  }
4305  }
4306  comm_k.bcast(num_gkvec__, 1, rank);
4307  comm_k.bcast(gvec_index__, *num_gkvec__, rank);
4308  comm_k.bcast(gkvec__, *num_gkvec__ * 3, rank);
4309  comm_k.bcast(gkvec_cart__, *num_gkvec__ * 3, rank);
4310  comm_k.bcast(gkvec_len, *num_gkvec__, rank);
4311  comm_k.bcast(gkvec_tp__, *num_gkvec__ * 2, rank);
4312 }

4346 /*
4347 @api begin
4348 sirius_set_h_radial_integrals:

4350  arguments:
4351  handler:
4352  type: void*
4353  attr: in, required
4354  doc: Simulation context handler.
4355  ia:

4387  ilo2:
4388  type: int
4389  attr: in, optional
4390  doc: 2nd index or local orbital.
4391 @api end
4392 */
4393 void sirius_set_h_radial_integrals(void* const* handler__,
4394  int* ia__,
4395  int* lmmax__,
4396  double* val__,
4397  int* l1__,
4398  int* o1__,
4399  int* ilo1__,
4400  int* l2__,
4401  int* o2__,
4402  int* ilo2__)
4403 {
4404  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
4405  int ia = *ia__ - 1;
4406  int idxrf1{-1};
4407  int idxrf2{-1};
4408  if ((l1__ != nullptr && o1__ != nullptr && ilo1__ != nullptr) ||
4409  (l2__ != nullptr && o2__ != nullptr && ilo2__ != nullptr)) {
4410  TERMINATE("wrong combination of radial function indices");
4411  }
4412  if (l1__ != nullptr && o1__ != nullptr) {
4413  idxrf1 = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(ia).type().indexr_by_l_order(*l1__, *o1__ - 1);
4414  } else if (ilo1__ != nullptr) {
4415  idxrf1 = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(ia).type().indexr_by_idxlo(*ilo1__ - 1);
4416  } else {
4417  TERMINATE("1st radial function index is not valid");
4418  }
4419 
4420  if (l2__ != nullptr && o2__ != nullptr) {
4421  idxrf2 = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(ia).type().indexr_by_l_order(*l2__, *o2__ - 1);
4422  } else if (ilo2__ != nullptr) {
4423  idxrf2 = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(ia).type().indexr_by_idxlo(*ilo2__ - 1);
4424  } else {
4425  TERMINATE("2nd radial function index is not valid");
4426  }
4427 
4428  for (int lm = 0; lm < *lmmax__; lm++) {
4429  sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(ia).h_radial_integrals(idxrf1, idxrf2)[lm] = val__[lm];
4430  }
4431 }

4632  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
4633 
4634  int ia = *ia__ - 1;
4635 
4636  auto& atom = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(ia);
4637 
4638  if (l__ != nullptr && o__ != nullptr && ilo__ != nullptr) {
4639  TERMINATE("wrong combination of radial function indices");
4640  }
4641  if (!(*deriv_order__ == 0 || *deriv_order__ == 1)) {
4642  TERMINATE("wrond radial derivative order");
4643  }
4644 
4645  int idxrf{-1};
4646  if (l__ != nullptr && o__ != nullptr) {
4647  idxrf = atom.type().indexr_by_l_order(*l__, *o__ - 1);
4648  } else if (ilo__ != nullptr) {
4649  idxrf = atom.type().indexr_by_idxlo(*ilo__ - 1);
4650  } else {
4651  TERMINATE("radial function index is not valid");
4652  }
4653 
4654  if (*deriv_order__ == 0) {
4655  for (int ir = 0; ir < atom.num_mt_points(); ir++) {
4656  atom.symmetry_class().radial_function(ir, idxrf) = f__[ir];
4657  }
4658  } else {
4659  for (int ir = 0; ir < atom.num_mt_points(); ir++) {
4660  atom.symmetry_class().radial_function_derivative(ir, idxrf) = f__[ir] * atom.type().radial_grid()[ir];
4661  }
4662  }
4663  if (l__ != nullptr && o__ != nullptr) {
4664  int n = atom.num_mt_points();
4665  atom.symmetry_class().aw_surface_deriv(*l__, *o__ - 1, *deriv_order__, f__[n - 1]);
4666  }
4667 }
4668 
4669 /*
4670 @api begin
4671 sirius_get_radial_function:
4672  doc: Get LAPW radial functions
4673  arguments:
4674  handler:
4675  type: void*
4676  attr: in, required
4677  doc: Simulation context handler.
4678  ia:
4679  type: int
4680  attr: in, required
4681  doc: Index of atom.
4682  deriv_order:
4683  type: int
4684  attr: in, required
4685  doc: Radial derivative order.
4686  f:
4687  type: double
4688  attr: out, required
4689  doc: Values of the radial function.
4690  l:
4691  type: int
4692  attr: in, optional
4693  doc: Orbital quantum number.
4694  o:
4695  type: int
4696  attr: in, optional
4697  doc: Order of radial function for l.
4698  ilo:
4699  type: int
4700  attr: in, optional
4701  doc: Local orbital index.
4702 @api end
4703 */
4704 void sirius_get_radial_function(void* const* handler__,
4705  int const* ia__,
4706  int const* deriv_order__,
4707  double* f__,
4708  int const* l__,
4709  int const* o__,
4710  int const* ilo__)
4711 {
4712  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
4713 
4714  int ia = *ia__ - 1;
4715 
4716  auto& atom = sim_ctx.unit_cell().atom(ia);
4717 
4718  if (l__ != nullptr && o__ != nullptr && ilo__ != nullptr) {
4719  TERMINATE("wrong combination of radial function indices");
4720  }
4721  if (!(*deriv_order__ == 0 || *deriv_order__ == 1)) {
4722  TERMINATE("wrond radial derivative order");
4723  }
4724 
4725  int idxrf{-1};
4726  if (l__ != nullptr && o__ != nullptr) {
4727  idxrf = atom.type().indexr_by_l_order(*l__, *o__ - 1);
4728  } else if (ilo__ != nullptr) {
4729  idxrf = atom.type().indexr_by_idxlo(*ilo__ - 1);
4730  } else {
4731  TERMINATE("radial function index is not valid");
4732  }
4733 
4734  if (*deriv_order__ == 0) {
4735  for (int ir = 0; ir < atom.num_mt_points(); ir++) {
4736  f__[ir] = atom.symmetry_class().radial_function(ir, idxrf);
4737  }
4738  } else {
4739  for (int ir = 0; ir < atom.num_mt_points(); ir++) {
4740  f__[ir] = atom.symmetry_class().radial_function_derivative(ir, idxrf) / atom.type().radial_grid()[ir];
4741  }
4742  }
4743 }

4815  section:
4816  type: string
4817  attr: in, required
4818  doc: Name of the section.
4819  elem:
4820  type: int
4821  attr: in, required
4822  doc: Index of the option.
4823  key_name:
4824  type: string
4825  attr: out, required
4826  doc: Name of the option.
4827  type:
4828  type: int
4829  attr: out, required
4830  doc: Type of the option (real, integer, boolean, string).
4831 @api end
4832 */
4833 
4834 void sirius_option_get_name_and_type(char const* section__, int const* elem__, char* key_name__, int* type__)
4835 {
4836  const json &dict = sirius::get_options_dictionary();
4837 
4838  auto section = std::string(section__);
4839  std::transform(section.begin(), section.end(), section.begin(), ::tolower);
4840 
4841  int elem = 0;
4842  *type__ = -1;
4843  for (auto& el : dict[section].items()) {
4844  if (elem == *elem__) {
4845  if (!dict[section][el.key()].count("default_value")) {
4846  std::cout << "key : " << el.key() << "\n the default_value key is missing" << std::endl;
4847  exit(0);
4848  }
4849  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"].is_array()) {
4850  *type__ = 10;
4851  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"][0].is_number_integer()) {
4852  *type__ += 1;
4853  }
4854  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"][0].is_number_float()) {
4855  *type__ += 2;
4856  }
4857  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"][0].is_boolean()) {
4858  *type__ += 3;
4859  }
4860  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"][0].is_string()) {
4861  *type__ += 4;
4862  }
4863  } else {
4864  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"].is_number_integer()) {
4865  *type__ = 1;
4866  }
4867  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"].is_number_float()) {
4868  *type__ = 2;
4869  }
4870  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"].is_boolean()) {
4871  *type__ = 3;
4872  }
4873  if (dict[section][el.key()]["default_value"].is_string()) {
4874  *type__ = 4;
4875  }
4876  }
4877  std::memcpy(key_name__, el.key().c_str(), el.key().size() + 1);
4878  }
4879  elem++;
4880  }
4881 }

5237 void sirius_option_set_int(void* const* handler__, char*section, char *name, int *default_values, int *length)
5238 {
5239  auto& sim_ctx = get_sim_ctx(handler__);
5240  /* dictionary describing all the possible options */
5241  json const& parser = sirius::get_options_dictionary();
5242 
5243  /* dictionary containing the values of the options for the simulations */
5244  json& conf_dict = sim_ctx.get_runtime_options_dictionary();
5245

5247  for ( char *p = section; *p; p++) *p = tolower(*p);

5249

5251  // check that the option exists

5255  for (int s = 0; s < *length; s++)
5256  v[s] = default_values[s];
5257  conf_dict[section][name] = v;
5258  } else {
5259  conf_dict[section][name] = *default_values;
5260  }

5306  for (int s = 0; s < *length; s++)
5307  v[s] = default_values[s];
5308  conf_dict[section][name] = v;
5309  } else {
5310  conf_dict[section][name] = *default_values;
5311  }
5312  }
5313 }

5343 {

5347  json &conf_dict = sim_ctx.get_runtime_options_dictionary();
5348  // ugly as hell but fortran is a piece of ....
5349  for ( char *p = section; *p; p++) *p = tolower(*p);
5350  // ugly as hell but fortran is a piece of ....
5351  for ( char *p = name; *p; p++) *p = tolower(*p);
5352  std::cout << section << " " << name << std::endl;
5353 
5354  if (parser[section].count(name)) {
5355  // check that the option exists
5356  if (*length > 1) {
5357  // we are dealing with a vector
5358  std::vector<bool> v(*length);

5360  v[s] = (default_values[s] == 1);
5361  }
5362  conf_dict[section][name] = v;
5363  } else {
5364  conf_dict[section][name] = (*default_values == 1);
5365  }
5366  }
